content.question: A triangular-shaped piece of glass rests in a tank of water, as shown in the figure. A horizontal beam of light is shined into the water and then passes into the glass. The water and the glass have refractive indexes of <math alttext="1.33" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.33</mn></math> and <math alttext="1.50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.50</mn></math>, respectively, and the glass is in the shape of a <math alttext="30, 60, 90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">‐</mo><mn>60</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">‐</mo><mn>90</mn></math> right triangle oriented as indicated in the figure. What is the angle of refraction for the beam as it passes from the glass back into the water?
